title: Northwestern's Kellogg School Makes an M.B.A. Play for Laid-Off Tech Workers
description: The business school says it will waive testing requirements for those who apply for a graduate degree after mass layoffs at Meta, Twitter and other big tech companies

title: Amazon Set to Lay Off Thousands of Corporate Workers
description: The layoffs are targeted for corporate employees and could primarily affect Amazon’s devices business, as well as human resources and retail, according to a person familiar with the matter.

title: Elon Musk's Tesla Compensation Trial Kicks Off
description: Musk and other Tesla directors are expected to testify over his multibillion-dollar pay package.

title: Google Reaches $391.5 Million Settlement With States Over Location Tracking Practices
description: Attorneys general found that Google violated state consumer protection laws by misleading consumers about its location-data practices, tracking consumers even when their location history setting was turned off.

title: The Risky Business of Sam Bankman-Fried
description: The FTX founder’s approach to risk fueled his rise to the top of the crypto world. Then came the catastrophic fall.

title: Ant's Consumer-Lending Unit to Raise $1.5 Billion in New Capital
description: The Chinese financial-technology is scaling back its fundraising ambitions after a large state-backed investor backed out of a previous plan.
